# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    line = ""
    wrapped_text = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            wrapped_text *= line * "\n"
            line = word
        else
            line *= line == "" ? word : " " * word
        end
    end
    wrapped_text *= line
    return wrapped_text
end

example_text = "Julia is a high-level, high-performance dynamic programming language for technical computing."
println(wrap_string(example_text, 15))

```
This `wrap_string` function iterates over the words in the provided text, wrapping the text so that no line exceeds the specified `text_width` (default is 10 characters), inserting new lines as necessary. In the example usage, the `text_width` is set to 15 for demonstration.
